title: SJB to begin dialogue with UNP
byline: The working committee of the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) today approved a proposal to begin a dialogue with the United National Party (UNP), SJB General Secretary Ranjith Madduma Bandara said.

title: Males continue to account for most HIV/AIDS cases in Sri Lanka
byline: During the first nine months of 2024, over 70 HIV-positive males are between 15-24 years old, while only five female cases were reported in this age group, according official data.

title: Pope suffers bruise on right forearm due to a fall
byline: Pope Francis sustained a bruise on his right forearm, with no fractures this morning due to a fall at Santa Marta,

title: SL, China agree to push for early conclusion of FTA
byline: Sri Lanka and China have agreed to work towards the early conclusion of a comprehensive Free Trade Agreement (FTA) in one package in line with the principles of equality, mutual benefit, and win-win outcomes, a joint statement from the two countries highlighted.

title: Govt. unveils relief measures to support affected SMEs
byline: The Government has unveiled a comprehensive relief package to assist Small and Medium-sized Enterprises (SMEs) grappling with financial hardships caused by recent economic upheavals.

title: CTU complains about exam centre closure over saree policy
byline: The Ceylon Teachers’ Union (CTU) lodged a complaint with the Education Ministry Secretariat and the Examinations Commissioner General regarding the closure of the exam centre at Dharmapala Vidyalaya, Pannipitiya, on Wednesday (15), allegedly due to teachers not arriving at the school dressed in sarees.

title: Salochana Gamage and businessman further remanded till January 27
byline: Former Provincial Councillor Salochana Gamage, and another who had been arrested for allegedly accepting a bribe, were further remanded till January 27 by Colombo Chief Magistrate Thanuja Lakmali.

title: Several train services to be cancelled today
byline: Several train services will be cancelled today due to a shortage of locomotive operators, with only 42 operators available, the Railways Department said.

title: Three parliamentary employees guilty of sexual harassment dismissed from service
byline: Three employees of Parliament who were found guilty of sexual harassment on female staff of Parliament have been dismissed, Communications Department of parliament said.

title: Gotabaya Rajapaksa arrives at CID
byline: Former President Gotabaya Rajapaksa arrived at the CID a short while ago to record a statement.

title: D.V. Chanaka criticises Government’s failure in 110 days
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP D.V. Chanaka criticised the government for failing to show progress in the first 110 days, despite expectations of improvement within 100 days.

title: Udayanga Weeratunga granted bail
byline: Former Sri Lankan Ambassador to Russia, Udayanga Weeratunga, who was remanded over the assault of a neighbor, was released on bail by the Nugegoda Magistrate’s Court.

title: Tri-Forces to assist with paddy purchasing during Maha Season
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has instructed the Ministry of Defence to take steps to develop necessary infrastructure facilities and provide technical assistance and labour support from the Tri-Forces to repair warehouses belonging to the Paddy Marketing Board (PMB) and Sathosa to facilitate the purchasing of paddy in the upcoming Maha season.

title: Five-day workweek for export sector extended for six months from January
byline: The five-day workweek for export sector industries has been extended for the next six months, starting January 1st, following approval by the Labour Advisory Council, subject to the instructions and final approval of the Labour Commissioner General.

title: Mano Ganesan holds special discussion with UK High Commissioner
byline: MP and leader of the Tamil Progressive Alliance (TPA) Mano Ganesan, held a special meeting with the UK’s High Commissioner Andrew Patrick to discuss key issues, including the unique challenges faced by Malaiyaha (up-country) Tamil Sri Lankans.

title: Health issues among schoolchildren on the rise, warns expert
byline: Sri Lanka is facing a troubling increase in health issues among schoolchildren, with a rise in non-communicable diseases such as Type 2 diabetes, high blood pressure and chronic liver and lung conditions.

title: Bus with Russian tourists collides on expressway, driver killed
byline: A bus carrying a group of Russian tourists collided with a cement truck travelling in the same direction near the 138-mile post on the Southern Expressway towards Tangalle early this morning (17).

title: Canadian goes missing at Hikkaduwa beach
byline: A 19-year-old Canadian national went missing while bathing off Hikkaduwa beach last evening.

title: SpaceX Starship test fails after Texas launch
byline: The latest test of Space X’s giant Starship rocket has failed, minutes after launch.
